headline.main: BRITAIN WON'T ENTER POLISH-CZECH CLASH; Attlee Explains Issue Is Matter Concerning Only 2 Allies

lead_paragraph: LONDON, June 2 -- Deputy Prime Minister Clement R. Attlee assured questioners in the House of Commons today that Britain did not intend to meddle in the relations between Poland and Czechoslovakia. He said that the Polish claim to parts of Silesia and Slovakia, annexed at the time of the Munich agreement, was "a matter which concerns the two Allied countries" and declined to intervene as suggested.
abstract: Brit Sec Attlee on Polish territorial claims to Silesia and Slovakia parts
